title: May Finds His Voice
backCoverBlurb: May is running for class president but he's nervous about public speaking. A story about finding confidence and speaking up for what you believe in.
characterDescription: A young toddler boy with dark blonde, curly hair and big blue eyes. He has an expressive and slightly nervous face. He is wearing a blue and white striped shirt.

pages.text: May wanted to be the leader of his playgroup. He had big ideas!
pages.imagePrompt: May with curly blonde hair looking determined and inspired.

pages.text: But when he tried to speak, his voice felt very small and quiet.
pages.imagePrompt: May looking a bit shy with his hands together, blue eyes looking down.

pages.text: What if no one listens to me? May wondered with a sigh.
pages.imagePrompt: May with a worried expression, sitting on a colorful rug.

pages.text: He practiced his speech in front of his teddy bear.
pages.imagePrompt: May standing in front of his teddy bear and talking to it.

pages.text: I want more snacks for everyone! May told the teddy.
pages.imagePrompt: May gesturing towards a bowl of fruit and crackers.

pages.text: Then, it was time to speak in front of all his friends.
pages.imagePrompt: A group of children sitting in a circle, looking at May.

pages.text: May's heart went thump-thump. He took a very deep breath.
pages.imagePrompt: May with his hand on his heart, taking a deep breath.

pages.text: He opened his mouth and out came a strong, clear voice!
pages.imagePrompt: May speaking with confidence, looking happy and brave.

pages.text: Everyone cheered for May's great ideas. You are a leader! they said.
pages.imagePrompt: The children clapping and smiling for May.

pages.text: May felt so proud of himself. He had found his voice today.
pages.imagePrompt: May with a big, joyful smile and bright blue eyes.

pages.text: Speaking up for what is right made May feel very strong.
May was ready to lead his friends with kindness and courage.
pages.imagePrompt: May standing at the head of the group, leading the way.
